Wanderers Travelogue

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Must play as a Ren character.

How to Participate

  • As Ren, select [Ren Level Up Event] Wanderers Travelogue from the Event List UI and click Participate to start.
    • You can track your progress anytime by selecting the same button in the Event List.
  • There are two types of missions in this event:
    • Weekly Mission: Defeat enemies to earn rewards that boost your EXP.
    • Step-Up Mission: Reach specific levels or defeat bosses to unlock milestone rewards.

Weekly Mission

  • Defeat enemies near your level (20 levels above and 20 levels below) and then click Claim in the Wanderers Travelogue UI to receive rewards based on the number of enemies defeated.
Enemies Defeated Reward
1,000 3x EXP Coupon (30 min) (x5): Untradable, expires February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.
5,000 VIP Booster (x10): Untradable, expires February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.
10,000 Luxe Sauna Coupon (x2): Tradable within world, expires February, 3 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.
  • For every 2,000 enemies defeated, you can also claim a 2x EXP Coupon (15 min): Untradable, expires February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.
    • This can be claimed up to 5 times per week, for a total of 10,000 enemies defeated.

Step-Up Mission

  • There are 9 Step-Up missions to complete. Reach the required level or defeat bosses to earn each mission reward.
  • Select a mission and click Start Mission to begin. After meeting the requirements, click Complete to claim your reward and unlock the next mission.
Mission Reward
Mission 1
Create a Ren Character
  • CCPB (30 Days) Box: Untradable, expires February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.

    Open to receive:

    • CCPB (Pet): Untradable, 30-day duration.
  • Pendant of the Spirit: Untradable, 30-day duration.
  • Max Slot Selector Coupon (x4): Untradable, February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.
  • Transparent Equipment Set Box: Untradable, expires February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.

    Open to receive the Following

    • Clear Glasses: Untradable, 90-day duration.
    • Transparent Face Accessory: Untradable, 90-day duration.
    • Transparent Earrings: Untradable, 90-day duration.
    • Transparent Gloves: Untradable, 90-day duration.

Tracks of the Wanderer

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above Ren characters.

How to Participate

  • As Ren, select [Ren Level Up Event] Tracks of the Wanderer from the Event List UI and click Participate to start.
    • You can track your progress anytime by selecting the same button in the Event List.
  • Complete various missions as Ren to unlock rewards throughout the event.
  • Rewards can be claimed by all characters within the same world.

Tracks of the Wanderer Rewards

  • When a mission is completed, the Claim button will unlock. Rewards can be claimed anytime during the event period and only once per account.

November 12 (after maintenance) - December 16 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 200 and above Ren characters.

How to Participate

  • As Ren, select Get a Sayaroid from the Event List UI and click Participate to claim a Sayaroid:
    • Heroic Worlds: Untradable, Permanent.
    • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within world, Permanent.

NEW UPDATES

Star Force Revamp

  • The maximum Star Force enhancement level for equipment Lv. 138+ is now 30-Stars.
  • Existing equipment with 23-Stars or higher has been adjusted to match the new enhancement changes:
Existing Enhancement Level New Enhancement Level
23-Star 25-Star
24-Star 28-Star
25-Star 30-Star
  • Safeguarding is now available up to 18-Star and the price to safeguard will be 200% of the base meso cost.
  • The amount of Star Force recovered from Equipment Traces now depends on the items enhancement level at the time of tracing, instead of being fixed at 12-Star.
Star Force Level Upon Destruction Recovered Star Force Level
15 - 19 12
20 15
21 - 22 17
23 - 25 19
26 - 30 20
  • Star Force levels will no longer decrease when an enhancement fails. The possible outcomes are now:
    • Success: Level increases
    • Maintain: Current Star Force level is kept
    • Destruction: Item is destroyed
  • Enhancement rates for 15-Star and above equipment have been changed.
Enhancement Level Success Chance Maintain Chance Destruction Chance
15 30.00% 67.90% 2.10%
16 30.00% 67.90% 2.10%
17 15.00% 78.20% 6.80%
18 15.00% 78.20% 6.80%
19 15.00% 76.50% 8.50%
20 30.00% 59.50% 10.50%
21 15.00% 72.25% 12.75%
22 15.00% 68.00% 17.00%
23 10.00% 72.00% 18.00%
24 10.00% 72.00% 18.00%
25 10.00% 72.00% 18.00%
26 7.00% 74.40% 18.60%
27 5.00% 76.00% 19.00%
28 3.00% 77.60% 19.40%
29 1.00% 79.20% 19.80%
  • Meso costs have also been adjusted to scale based on both equipment level and enhancement level.
  • New Star Force achievements have been added to celebrate when you reach higher enhancement milestones:
    • [Star Force] 26 Stars!
    • [Star Force] 27 Stars!
    • [Star Force] 28 Stars!
    • [Star Force] 29 Stars!
    • [Star Force] 30 Stars!
  • Demon Avengers Star Force Conversion skill is now capped at 410 Star Force.

Back to Top

[Developer Comment]
This update we introduced two restoration systems for different types of equipment:
  • Trace Restoration: This system is designed for Traces obtained from destroyed equipment which can be restored by completing missions in the Boss Mission UI. It applies to Weapons, Armor, and Accessories, while Badge items cannot be restored.
  • Star Force Research: This restoration system is for certain main set items such as armor and accessories. You can obtain materials called Star Cores through hunting, and these materials can be used to restore specific sets (approximately 900 items across 50 sets).

Trace Restoration System

The new Trace Restoration System lets you restore Equipment Traces and continue progressing toward your Star Force goals!

Requirements

  • Lv. 200 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

How to Participate

  • Accept the [Arthur and Red Beryl] Restoring Power quest from the light bulb notifier on the left side of the screen to start.
  • Access the Trace Restoration UI by pressing the hotkey or by clicking the Trace Restore button in a bosss UI.

  • Place an item in the Restoration Slot to register it. The gauge will then display how many points are required to restore it.
    • Badges cannot be restored.
    • If there isnt an item registered, the gauge can still be filled.

  • Earn points by completing boss missions and defeating the boss each week.
    • Defeats will only count when solo or in a solo party.
    • Missions cannot be completed in Practice Mode.
    • Only one character per world can attempt Trace Restoration each week.
  • Up to 1,750 points can be accumulated.

Recovered Enhancement Level

  • The Trace Restoration system follows the same enhancement level recovery conditions introduced in the Star Force Revamp.
Star Force Level Upon Destruction Recovered Star Force Level
15 - 19 12
20 15
21 - 22 17
23 - 25 19
26 - 30 20

Boss Missions

  • Select the missions youd like to challenge and click Start to save your selection.
    • You can change your selected missions at any time, or click Reset to clear all choices.

[Developer Comment]
This system was added to help restore equipment that is destroyed during Star Force enhancement. Since this feature is newly introduced after the 11/12 update, there isn't a way to identify the destroyed Star Force level of existing Equipment Traces. Please note that equipment destroyed before the system was introduced are restored to 12-Star as per the existing rules.

Back to Top

Star Force Research

Fabian, a Star Force researcher, might have the solution youve been waiting for! Hes figured out a way to not only restore equipment traces, but to also create new boss equipment - and now he needs your help to test out his theory.

Requirements

  • Lv. 200 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

How to Participate

  • Accept the [Fabians Research] The Stars Force quest from the light bulb notifier on the left side of the screen to start.

Core Restoration

According to Fabians research, restoring destroyed equipment is possible if you collect the right materials. Follow the steps below to bring your equipment back to life!

  • Collect Mysterious Star Speck Boxes, which are dropped at a set chance when you defeat monsters near your level.
  • Open the box to randomly obtain either Star Specks or Shining Star Specks. These are special materials used to craft Star Cores needed for restoration.
Star Specks
Shining Star Specks
  • Craft the Star Core you need. Each Star Core type restores specific kinds of equipment, so make sure to craft the one thats compatible with your Equipment Trace!
Core Type Materials Required Equipment Restored

Star Core		 200 Star Specks Lv. 200 or below equipment set that can always be obtained

Dawn Star Core		 1 Star Core
+
25 Shining Star Specks		 Dawn Boss Set equipment

Pitched Star Core		 1 Star Core
+
50 Shining Star Specks		 Pitched Boss Set equipment
  • A Trace/Core Restoration tab has been added to the Enhance UI. Open this tab to restore your equipment.
    • Select your Equipment Trace, then the Star Core you crafted
    • Click Transfer to bring your item back!

Creating Equipment

Fabian and his team have also discovered Whisper Crystals. Theyre mysterious objects that can be used to create powerful boss equipment by fusing them together.

  • There are two types of Whisper Crystals, each used to create different Boss Set equipment when enough crystals have been collected.
Whisper Crystal Type Crystals Required Equipment Created

Dawn Whisper Crystal		 65 Dawn Boss Set equipment

Pitched Whisper Crystal		 130 Pitched Boss Set equipment
260 Mitra's Rage Selection Box
390 Genesis Badge
  • Dawn Whisper Crystals or Pitched Whisper Crystals can be obtained depending on the boss and its difficulty.
Boss Dawn Whisper Crystal
(Difficulty)		 Pitched Whisper Crystal
(Difficulty)
Lotus N/A Hard, Extreme
Damien N/A Hard
Guardian Angel Slime Normal, Chaos N/A
Lucid Normal, Hard Hard
Will Normal, Hard Hard
Darknell Normal, Hard Hard
Gloom Normal, Chaos Chaos
Verus Hilla Normal, Hard Hard
Seren Normal, Hard, Extreme Hard, Extreme
Black Mage N/A Hard, Extreme
  • When enough crystals are gathered, talk to Fabian to fuse them into a boss equipment of your choice!
[Developer Comment]
This system was added to help restore equipment that is destroyed during Star Force enhancement. Since this feature is newly introduced after the 11/12 update, there isn't a way to identify the destroyed Star Force level of existing Equipment Traces. Please note that equipment destroyed before the system was introduced are restored to 12-Star as per the existing rules.

Arthurs Equipment Rental

November 12 (after maintenance) - April 21 11:59 PM UTC

Borrow powerful Red Beryl gear to give your adventure an extra boost! Stop by and get equipped for your next challenge.

Requirements

  • Lv. 200 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Completed 5th Job Advancement.

How to Participate

  • Select Arthurs Equipment Rental within the Event List and click Participate to access the Rent shop.
  • You can rent each equipment item up to 3 times per week, per character.
    • Mesos can be used to rent equipment for the first time. Maple Points will be required for subsequent rentals of that equipment.
  • The countdown will begin the moment an item has been successfully rented and the item is in your inventory.
    • Any equipment rented in your inventory cannot be discarded, and will be removed automatically when expired.
  • No types of enhancements are available for Equipment Rentals.

Genesis Pass

Sale Period: November 13 12:00 AM UTC - February 2, 2026 11:59 PM UTC

Pass Use: Expires February 3, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC

Pass Perks Effect: Applied until February 10, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC

Get on the fast track to your Genesis Weapon with the all-new Genesis Pass!

Requirements

  • Purchase Requirements: Only Lv. 255+ characters that havent completed the final awakening of the Genesis Weapon.
  • Pass Usage Requirements: Only Lv. 255+ characters that have the [Genesis Weapon] Traces of Von Leon the Lion King quest either in progress or completed, and the [Genesis Weapon] Power Unbound, Stage 2 quest not completed. Characters that already completed the Genesis awakening cannot use it.

How to Participate

  • The Genesis Pass can be purchased through the Cash Shop for 30,000 NX (Use the Genesis Pass in your Cash Inventory).
    • The pass is Untradable and can be purchased up to 2 times per account.
    • Cannot be used by characters that have already completed the Genesis Weapon's final awakening.

Benefits of the Genesis Pass

  • Party Limit Expanded
    • Players who have the Genesis Pass and are on the same Genesis Mission stage can now form parties of up to 6 members instead of the usual 2.
    • Penalties for each Genesis Mission, including the 50% Final Damage reduction when proceeding with a party, will still apply.
    • This feature is available for missions starting from Lotus and above.
  • Increased Trace of Darkness Obtained from bosses by 3x
    • If a weekly or monthly boss was already defeated during the week or month the Genesis Pass was used, a Trace of Darkness Coupon will be provided retroactively.
    • The Maximum Trace of Darkness that can be obtained is 3,000 and any additional Trace of Darkness obtained will disappear.
  • Trace of Darkness Boss Buff
    • A special buff is also applied when challenging bosses that drop Trace of Darkness.
Stat Value
All Stats 20
Attack Power & Magic Attack 20
Boss Damage 10%
Ignore Defense 10%
Max HP/MP 1,000
Arcane Power 150
  • Guaranteed Attack Power/Magic ATT Weapon Soul Upon Liberation
    • After obtaining the Genesis Weapon, receive a Commander's Soul Box: Untradable, expires February 11 11:59 PM UTC.
    • Open the box to choose one of the following Commanders and receive a guaranteed Attack Power or Magic ATT Soul: Untradable, expires February 11 11:59 PM UTC.
      • Von Leon, Arkarium, Magnus, Lotus, Damien, Lucid, Will, Darknell, or Verus Hilla.

Back to Top

Special Skill Ring Swap

A new Swap Rings skill has been added, letting you instantly switch between two Special Skill Rings with the press of a button!

  • The skill can be found in the Beginner Skill tab within the Skill UI.

  • A reserve Special Skill Ring slot has been added to the Equipment Inventory UI. You can access it by clicking the icon displayed on your equipped Special Skill Ring. You can access it by clicking the icon displayed on your equipped Special Skill Ring.
  • To register a reserve ring, drag and drop a Special Skill Ring from your inventory into the slot.
    • Only untradable rings can be registered as a reserve ring.
    • Double-click the ring to unregister it.

  • Once registered, use the Swap Rings skill to instantly swap your equipped ring with your reserve ring anytime, anywhere!
  • The Swap Rings skill can only be used when:
    • A Special Skill Ring is equipped.
    • A Special Skill Ring is registered in the reserve slot.
  • The skills cooldown is not affected by any cooldown reset or reduction effects.

Back to Top

Buff Sequence System

  • The Buff Sequence system has arrived! Quickly use your favorite buff skills and items with the single press of a button
  • Access the Buff Sequence UI by opening the Sequence UI and clicking the Buffs tab.
  • Create a sequence by clicking on a row and selecting the buff skills and items you want.

    • 30 buff skills and items can be registered in a Buff Sequence, but only certain skills and items can be added.
  • Buff Sequences cannot be used while in a boss map.

Field Content Revamp

Treasure Hunter

  • There are two types of Treasure Chests that may appear at a set chance when defeating monsters within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above).
    • Golden Treasure Chest
    • Diamond Treasure Chest
  • You can find up to 10 total combined Golden and Diamond Treasure Chests per day.
    • The Diamond Treasure Chest will not appear in fields where enemies are Lv. 230 and below.
  • Open the Treasure Chest by attacking it. While attacking, theres a chance that the Treasure Chest rank can be upgraded based on the enemy level of the current field:
    • Enemies Lv. 140 - 169: Can be upgraded to Epic.
    • Enemies Lv. 170 - 199: Can be upgraded to Unique.
    • Enemies Lv. 200 and above: Can be upgraded to Legendary.
  • Treasure Chests have four ranks: Rare > Epic > Unique > Legendary.
    • The rank of Treasure Chests that appear in the field are Rare by default.
  • When a Treasure Chest is opened, a Jewel will appear, and when picked up it will give a large amount of EXP based on the Treasure Chests type and rank.
  • The following Treasure Hunter achievements have been added:
    • [Treasure Hunter] A Stroke of Luck
    • [Treasure Hunter] A Repeat Discovery
    • [Treasure Hunter] The End of the Collection
    • [Treasure Hunter] A Radiance Never Before Seen
  • When a Treasure Chest appears and you encounter either Pollo or Fritto, there is a set chance to start the following quest that rewards a medal:
NPC Encountered Quest Medal
Pollo [Treasure Hunter] Pollos Call Pollo's Friend: Untradable, Permanent
Fritto [Treasure Hunter] Frittos Call Fritto's Friend: Untradable, Permanent

Rune of Blessing

The Rune of Blessing has arrived! A powerful new rune that grants even greater EXP gains through the blessing of an Ancient Rune.

  • When liberated, the Rune of Blessing grants an additional 200% EXP buff and summons an Ancient Rune that periodically attacks nearby enemies.
  • Heres how the Rune of Blessing appears:
    • The Rune of Blessing can appear after 4 normal Runes have been liberated.
    • Starting from the fifth rune spawn, there is a chance for it to appear as the Rune of Blessing.
    • If the Rune of Blessing does not appear during that cycle, the appearance rate increases in the next cycle.
    • The Rune of Blessing is guaranteed to appear at a specific cycle.
    • Once the Rune of Blessing is liberated, a normal Rune will appear again in the next cycle.
    • There is a rare chance for the Rune of Blessing to appear twice in a row. Liberating the second Rune of Blessing counts toward the number of normal Runes needed for the next cycle.
Runes Liberated Count Rune of Blessings Spawn Chance
1 - 4 0%
(Normal Runes only)
5 50%
6 60%
7 75%
8 100%

Instanced Maps

  • Hunting field maps with enemies Lv. 60 and above will now be instanced.
    • Heroic Worlds: Up to 4 players can be on the same map.
    • Challenger-Heroic: Up to 10 players can be on the same map.
  • Maps are not instanced in certain areas, including: Job Tutorial fields, Mirror World, FriendStory, Grand Athenaeum, and other locations where Runes do not spawn.

Bounty Hunter Content Removal

  • The Bounty Hunter content, including Pollo, Fritto, Especia, and Inferno Wolf Portals, has been removed and will no longer appear in hunting fields.
    • Pollo and Fritto Entry Tickets can no longer be used.
    • Bounty Hunter-related achievements have been moved to the Memories tab.
  • The amount of Spell Traces and Medals of Honor dropped when defeating Elite Monsters has been increased.
  • Bounty Hunter Monsterbloom has been added to the Monster Park Shop.
    • Quantity limit records reset every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.

Cash Shop Improvements

  • Improved the face preview under the Face category so your characters image now appears at 2x magnification when viewing face coupons.
  • Added a 2x magnification option to the character preview.
    • The 2x zoom is automatically applied when viewing the Hair and Face categories.
  • Added a feature to preview Colorblends for Hair and Face.
  • Added a new feature that allows you to select or remove multiple items from Cash Inventory by dragging the mouse to highlight and select items.
  • Added where Rank and Equip Priority can now be sorted in the Cash Inventory.
  • Added where items in your inventory tab can now be equipped by right-clicking it.
  • Added sound effects when adding or removing items from the cart.
  • Added a notification when an item in the cart is no longer available for purchase.
  • Cash Effects in the preview can now be canceled by double clicking on the item.
  • Moving items to the Cash Inventory will automatically switch the tab to All.
  • Moving items from the Cash Inventory will automatically switch to the corresponding tab.
  • Equipped Pets can now be moved to the Cash Inventory, and their equipped Pet Equipment will move with them.
  • Changed so Cash Inventory filters are now kept unless you switch tabs or add items outside the filter.
  • Changed so moving items to and from the Cash Inventory will now automatically switch to its corresponding tab.
  • Changed so the Purchase button is disabled when no items are selected or the quantity is zero.
  • Resolved an issue where Throwing Stars and Kaiser wings appeared misaligned in the Cash Shop preview.
  • An option to use up to 5 Premium Surprise Style Boxes at once has been added.
  • A new Premium Surprise Style Box icon and animation has been added.
  • Resolved an issue where a pet in the Cash Inventory could still be equipped even when pets were set to OFF in the character preview screen.

UI Changes and Bug Fixes

Invincibility Indicator Effect

  • A new visual effect has been added to the HP/MP gauge to help you easily recognize when an invincibility effect is active.
    • The effect does not trigger for brief invincibility durations (~1 second) or during a casting animation.

Event List UI

  • A new Favorites feature has been added to the Event List UI.
  • Click the Favorites icon, select your preferred events, and theyll appear at the top of the list. Click the Favorites icon again to save your selection.
    • Favorites are saved per character.

Auction House Relist UI

  • The price of an item can now be immediately changed when re-listing an item.
  • A new pop-up UI appears when re-listing expired items, replacing the old Auction House listing area UI.

Storage UI

  • The Storage UI design has been changed. It can now be opened from the Inventory UI, Menu UI, or through a keybind.
    • Storage UI is restricted in boss fields.
  • Auto-Store Button: Automatically move items from your inventory to Storage, if they match items already stored.
  • Find All Button: Move all stored items to your characters inventory.

Boss Reward UI

  • Added a Boss Reward UI in Inventory UI to access Boss Rewards obtained through the Boss Reward Party Distribution system.
    • Boss Reward UI is restricted in boss fields.
  • The Boss Reward UI is limited to storing Boss Rewards only.

Beauty Salon Update

  • A new Skin tab has been added to the Beauty Salon UI. Skin color options can now be saved!
  • 3 Skin slots are unlocked by default and up to 100 Skins can be saved.

Common UIs

  • Shop UI
    • Changed the Shop UI to display remaining purchase quantities limits and expiration information.
    • Changed where in the Challenger Coin Shop multiple Spell Trace bundles can be purchased at once.
    • Changed so multiple Circulator items can now be purchased at once.
    • Added a Shop UI expansion mode where the inventory view can be expanded.
    • Added a feature where items can be purchased or sold by right clicking.
    • Added a tab in Shops that displays all Weekly Intense Power Crystals sold.
  • Improved so that detailed information is displayed in the Auction Houses Sale Complete and Sale End notification pop-ups.

  • Changed so that the Special tab is now displayed first when opening the Monster Park General Store.
  • Changed Sayrams Elixir duration to 15 minutes in Boss Practice Mode and Fog Forest Training Grounds.
  • Changed the following Guild Skills to last 30 minutes in Boss Practice Mode and Fog Forest Training Grounds:
    • Boss Slayers

Quest/Story Changes and Bug Fixes

Sol Erda Quest Changes

  • The [Daily Quest] Erdas Request has been changed to a Weekly Quest and can be completed once per account.
  • The new [Weekly Quest] Erdas Request requires defeating 5,000 enemies within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above).
'[Weekly Quest] Erda's Request' Information
Participation Can be completed once per account. Resets every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.
Objective Defeat 5,000 Sacred Power Field Enemies
Rewards
  • Sol Erda (x9): Tradable within world, 7-day duration.
  • Sol Erda Fragment x90
    • Heroic Worlds: Untradable, Permanent.
    • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within world, Permanent.
[Developer Comment]
The Sol Erda quest has been updated so that Erdas Request, which was previously available once per character is now shared per account and resets weekly. To maintain balance, the completion rewards have been adjusted. The number of fragments obtainable per week has been increased compared to before. The amount of Sol Erda rewards has also been increased and is adjusted to give more than the total amount of rewards previously earned by completing the quest with two characters.

Job Story Quest Skip

  • Added a feature that allows players to choose whether to skip Job Story Quests during character creation.
    • Kanna, Hayato, and Sia characters cannot use the Job Story Quest skip feature.
  • There are two options to choose from:
    • Skip Quest: Skips story quests from Lv. 1 - 30.
    • Quest Summary: View a summary of the story from Lv. 1 - 30.
  • When either option is selected:
    • Your character will start at Lv. 30 upon entering the world (Zero characters will start at Lv. 120 with Story Quest Act 2 completed).
    • All related story quests will be marked as completed.
    • Skills obtained through those quests will be automatically learned.
    • Job-exclusive item rewards from those quests will be distributed.
    • Your character will be Lv. 30 upon joining the world.
  • The price of equipment obtained through character creation or Lv. 1 - 30 story quests has been changed to 0 mesos.

Arcane River and Grandis Story Quest Skip

  • The Arcane River and Grandis region Story Quest Skip feature has been added to Challenger Worlds.
    • Viewing the summarized story or skipping the Story Quests will automatically complete all quests associated with it. Item rewards (except for EXP) will be given.

Commerci Story Quest Skip

  • When one character within world completes the Commerci prerequisite quests, other characters within the same world can now choose to view a summarized story or skip the quests entirely
    • Choosing either option will automatically complete all prerequisite quests. All quest rewards except EXP will be given.

Express Pass Improvements

  • Using a Symbol Express Pass to complete an Arcane River weekly quest will now grant EXP.
    • Weekly Quest Completion EXP can be obtained up to 3 times per week per world.
    • Regardless of the amount of Maple Points consumed, EXP equivalent to one clear will be awarded.
  • Changed where the Epic Dungeon Express Pass can now be used without needing to have cleared the dungeon first.

Grand Athenaeum Update

  • Ren has been added to Maple Chronicle: Book of the Beginning.
    • Obtain Book of Ren achievement to unlock the story.

Boss/Mob Changes and Bug Fixes

Boss Preparation Map and Skill Cooldown Reset Feature

  • When entering a weekly or monthly boss battle, youll now be moved to a Boss Preparation Map where youll have 10 minutes to get ready for the fight.
  • When entering the Boss Preparation Map:
    • The cooldown of certain skills will reset.
    • Charge-type skills and job gauges will be fully charged.
    • Soul Weapon will have maximum Soul Points.
  • When you leave the boss battle and exit the map, your skill cooldowns, charges, and gauges will return to their previous state before entering.
  • Charge-type skills and job gauges that fully charge:
    • Hero - Flash Blade
    • Bow Master - Silhouette Mirage
    • Pathfinder - Relix Gauge
    • Cannoneer - HEXA Rolling Rainbow (contact list)
    • Aran - Combo Count
    • Luminous - Equilibrium, Liberation Orb
    • Kaiser - Morph Gauge
    • Xenon - Supply Surplus
    • Hayato - Sword Energy
    • Kain - Malice
    • Adele - Aether Weaving
    • Illium - Crystal Charges
    • Ark - Spectra
    • Hoyoung - Talisman Energy and Scroll Energy
  • While inside the preparation map, you can do the following:
    • Use Buff Sequence, Noblesse Guild Skills, Champions Renown
    • Charge abilities
    • Manage Link Skills and Character Preset
    • Use Sayrams Elixir, Aurelias Elixir, Collectors Elixir
  • All buff effects are removed when entering the preparation map. However, the following buffs will NOT be removed:
    • Consumable and Cash item effects
    • Toggle skills
    • Summon Skills with no cooldown that persist between maps
    • Noblesse Guild Skills
    • Weapon Tempering and Accessory Enhancement
    • Blessing of the 250 Effect
    • Champions Renown
  • The following skills will not have their buff effects and cooldowns reset:
    • Common - Decent Sharp Eyes, Decent Hyper Body, Decent Combat Orders
    • Hero - Freuds Wisdom
    • Paladin - Combat Orders
    • Explorer Magician - Infinity
    • All Pirate - Roll of the Dice
    • Buccaneer - Time Leap
    • Luminous - The Crossroads of Destiny
    • Ark - Contact Caravan

    • The entry requirement to have a Fragment of Destiny key to challenge Black Mage has been removed.

    Boss Reward Party Distribution System (Heroic Worlds)

    • The Boss Reward Party Distribution System has been implemented in Heroic Worlds.
    • To change the pick-up rights, click the Settings button in the Party UI and select Distribution

    • When the pick-up rights are set to Distribution:
      • Rewards are divided equally among all party members through the Boss Reward UI after defeating a boss.
      • Power Rebirth Crystals are given to all party members, while other items are distributed randomly.
      • If a player leaves the party or map during the distribution setup, theyre excluded from the reward distribution.
      • Solo parties will always default to pick-up rights set to All.
    • For higher value items, when Distribution is enabled, each party member will receive a random number between 1 and 999 after the boss is defeated for a special distribution. The player with the highest number wins the reward.
      • Even if not all members participate, the distribution will proceed as if everyone is included.
    • Special distribution will occur for the following items:
    Boss Item
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) Damaged Black Heart
    Berserked
    Lotus (Extreme) Total Control
    Damien (Hard) Magic Eyepatch
    Lucid (Hard) Dreamy Belt

    Gloom (Chaos) Endless Terror
    Guard Captain Darknell (Hard) Commanding Force Earring
    Verus Hilla (Hard) Source of Suffering
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme) Genesis Badge
    Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme) Mitra's Rage Selection Box

Item Changes and Bug Fixes

Cernium Sacred Power Buff

  • Upon entering Cernium in Grandis, you can speak to Flame Priest to receive his blessing and obtain a Sacred Power Buff, which grants Sacred Power +30 for 1 hour.

  • The Flame Priest's Blessing buff can be obtained if the following conditions are met:
    • Completed the A Divine Power quest
    • Current Sacred Power is below 30
  • If youve already cleared at least one Sacred Area quest starting from Odium, you can no longer obtain this buff. However, if the buff is active when you clear the Odium quest, it will remain until the duration effect ends.

Collectors Elixir

  • Collectors Elixir, a new elixir with heroic powers that provides a strong buff, has been added to the Collectors Shop.
  • Characters Lv. 200 and above who have completed the [Collectors Request] quest can purchase elixirs from the Collector.
    • Upon completing the quest, other Lv. 200+ characters can purchase from the Collector without having to do the quest again.

TWILIGHT EVE EVENTS

Twilight Eve

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

The season of Twilight Eve has begun! Head to the Twilight Altar and join the festival. Your adventure awaits!

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

Quick Overview

Event Currency

  • Evernium is your ticket to power! Earn it by participating in festival activities, then exchange it at the Evernium Exchange to give your progression a massive boost!

Event Activities

  • Waking the Power of Time: Co-op event where all your characters within that world work together to complete the weekly collection goal.
  • Evernias Bounty: Log in and complete Daily & Weekly check-ins to receive Evernium and Ginseng/Licorice ingredients!
  • Seeking Traces of Time: Gain Traces of Time or Dark Traces of Time from the weekly bosses, and exchange this for useful progression items.
  • Blooms Herb Baskets: Collect Ginseng and Licorice and exchange them for event buffs!
  • Eternal Gilded Clockwork: Defeat Twisted monsters and receive EXP.
  • Eve Anticipation: Visit the Twilight Altar and receive EXP.

How to Participate

  • Select the '[Twilight Eve] Finding the Power of Time' event from the Event List, then click 'Participate' to join.
  • The event includes a 'Quick Start' feature to help you begin immediately.

Back to Top

Waking the Power of Time

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

The Twilight Eve Festival in Evernia has begun! Let's join forces with our friends to collect the essential Sands of Time and complete the hourglass!

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Completed the [Co-op Event] Waking the Power of Time quest

Event Overview

  • Complete the weekly collection goal for extra rewards and perks! You can earn rewards by completing 2 main tasks:
    • Progressing through the Weekly Collection Goal, where you can earn rewards or perks through the weekly Gift Goal and the Power of Time.
    • Accumulating Sands of Time, where you can use it to acquire Evernium (event currency used for the Evernium Exchange) and rewards from Prelude Participation Gift.

How to Participate

  • Select [Co-op Event] Waking the Power of Time from the Event List and click Participate to start and access the event UI.
    • Alternatively, accept the quest by talking to Arjana located at the event map.
  • Check your event progression at any time by clicking the [Co-op Event] Waking the Power of Time button within the Event List.
    • The Event progression is shared between characters within the account.

Weekly Collection Goal

  • This is a co-op event where you contribute to the weekly collection goal for every time you complete your individual weekly goal.
  • Fill up the Weekly Collection hourglass with Sands of Time to be able to claim rewards from the Prelude Participation Gift
    • The Power of Time will collect, increasing the in-game progress rate for each weekly collection goal.
  • When the weekly collection goal progress rate reaches 100%, all characters who participated in the event can receive each week's 'Power of Time' and 'Gift Goal'.

    • If you fail this week, last week's rewards will roll over and open up next week.
  • By completing each goal, you can also acquire Evernium.
    • 1 Sand of Time = 400 Evernium
    • Max 4,000 Evernium can be earned per week
    • Spend Evernium over at the exchange shop

Accumulating Sands of Time

  • There are 2 ways to accumulate Sands of Time:
    • Defeat enemies within your level range (20 levels above or 20 levels below).
      • This includes enemies that are defeated using VIP Boosters, HEXA Booster, Gilded Clockwork, and Eternal Gilded Clockwork.
      • You must defeat these enemies solo!
    • Defeat bosses.
      • You must clear the boss solo to receive Sands of Time.
      • See the table below for details on how much you can receive from defeating the Boss:
Sands of Time Obtained Boss

Normal Damien

  • Upon collecting Sands of Time, dont forget to click the Fill button to fill the hourglass.
  • You can fill Sands of Time up to 10 times per week, for a total of 110 Sands of Time throughout the event. But just remember, you have to do this solo!
  • You will obtain the Sands of Time immediately upon completing the final phase and defeating the boss.
  • You only get Sands of Time from a boss if its reward is a higher amount than what you already have. Bosses that give the same or less won't add any extra.
    • Example: After defeating Hard Lotus, you will have obtained a total of 4 Sands of Time even if you defeat Hard Damien or Normal Will. If you then defeat Hard Verus Hilla, you will obtain an additional 2 Sands of Time.
  • Dont think youre ready yet? You can still earn Sands of Time after you defeat the boss in Practice Mode.
  • The number of times you can fill the hourglass resets every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
  • Need to catch up? Sands of Time can be purchased to make up for times you missed.
    • 1 Sand of Time = 1,000 Maple Points

Prelude Participation Gift

  • Your total cumulative Sands of Time filled determines the various 'Prelude Participation Gifts' you can obtain.
  • Claim the reward items for each stage of the 'Prelude Participation Gift' by pressing the Claim button in the event UI.
    • Rewards can be claimed once per account.
  • All reward items must be claimed by February 3, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC and used by February 4, 2026 at 2:00 AM UTC.

Evernias Bounty

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Completed the [Co-op Event] Waking the Power of Time quest.

How to Participate

  • Check in daily and click the Launch Exploration Button to receive rewards!
  • Each check-in gives the Evernias Bounty gift plus the following rewards:
    • 3x 3x EXP Coupon
    • 5x Ginseng (ingredients used in Blooms Herb Baskets event)
    • 5x Licorice (ingredients used in Blooms Herb Baskets event)
  • Rewards can be claimed at any time during the event period! So there is no need to hoard or panic-claim everything at once!
  • You can complete the Daily Evernia Exploration up to 5 times per week, earning various cumulative rewards based on your total completions.
  • Missed a check-in? Purchase the Evernia Pass for 3,000 Maple Points to complete a missed day.
    • The number of Passes you can use is limited to the number of Daily Evernia Explorations you missed in the previous week, as of midnight every Wednesday.
  • Daily Evernia Exploration resets every day at 12:00 AM UTC.

Seeking Traces of Time

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

How to Participate

  • Successfully clear a Weekly Boss solo to qualify for participation!
    • Daily and Monthly bosses are not eligible.
  • Clearing a boss will accumulate Traces of Time and Dark Traces of Time. You can monitor your acquisition status by navigating to the Event List and clicking on [Boss Event] Seeking Traces of Time.
    • Obtain up to 2,000 Traces of Time and 50 Dark Traces of Time weekly per world. But dont forget! You must defeat the boss without a party to receive these!
    • Not ready for the real thing yet? You can still earn the Traces of Time and Dark Traces of Time after you defeat the boss in Practice Mode.
    • The collection of Traces of Time and Dark Traces of Time will end on February 3, 2026 at 11:59 PM and are usable only within the world they were obtained from.
  • If you defeat a weekly boss before the maintenance, you cannot receive Traces of Time and Dark Traces of Time.
    • Were you too quick to defeat the boss before the maintenance? You can still defeat it in Practice Mode after the maintenance to be able to obtain the Traces of Time.

Blooms Herb Baskets

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

How to Participate

  • Select [Event Skill] Bloom's Herb Baskets from the Event List and click Participate to start and access the Event UI.
  • You can also start the quest by talking to Bloom at the Twilight Altar.
  • Use the Ginseng and Licorice (earned from Evernias Bounty) to activate and level up the Herb Basket skills:
    • Ginseng: Enhance your stats.
      • 5x Ginseng earned from Evernias Bounty.
    • Licorice: Receive special perks for extra gains.
      • 5x Licorice earned from Evernias Bounty.

Blooms Herb Baskets Skill Details

  • Enhancing Ginseng Basket and Licorice Basket requires a set amount of Ginseng and Licorice for each level. Buffs and special perks can be enhanced up to Lv. 6.
    • Ginseng Basket: Skills that enhance your characters stats.
    • Licorice Basket: Skills that give you special perks.

  • Bloom's Herb Basket skills can be enhanced until February 3, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC and the skill effects last until February 10, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.

    • 5 of each herb becomes available for purchase every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
    • The weekly purchase limit accumulates across the event period, so you can stock up later if needed.

Notes for Blooms Licorice Basket

  • After defeating Lotus (Hard) or a higher difficulty boss, Sol Erda Energy is dropped by defeating the boss loot box.
  • The Arcane River Daily Mission Rewards and Grandis Daily Mission Rewards skill effects are applied once a day in each world and are applied when first completing a daily mission.
    • If you decline, you can still claim the reward with another character in the same world after completing the quest or a different daily quest.
  • The Arcane River and Grandis Daily Mission Reward skills offer an EXP boost and bonus Symbol distribution. These perks can be selectively applied to different characters and daily quests when you complete them.
  • The Arcane River Daily Mission Reward skill only applies the EXP boost perk upon completing a daily quest in the Tenebris area.
  • The Grandis Daily Mission Rewards skill only applies to Cernium, Hotel Arcus, Odium, Shangri-La, Arteria, Carcion, and Tallahart area daily quests.
  • You cannot get the additional rewards for daily quests that are already completed before activating the skill effect.
  • Legion Coins that are obtained from the Bonus Coins upon completing Legion weekly missions perk do not apply to Legion Coin-related achievements.

Eternal Gilded Clockwork

November 12 (after maintenance) - December 16 11:59 PM UTC

How to Participate

  • Select [Hunting Event] Eternal Gilded Clockwork from the Event List and click Participate to start and access the Event UI.
  • Defeat enemies within your level range (20 levels above and 20 levels below) where the usable items Gilded Clockwork or Eternal Gilded Clockwork can be dropped at a set chance.
    • Gilded Clockwork
      • When used, a Twisted Eye of Time monster will spawn and gives a lot of EXP when defeated.
      • Time limit: 100 seconds
      • Daily use limit: 10
    • Eternal Gilded Clockwork
      • When used, a Twisted Chronos monster will spawn and give even MORE EXP when defeated.
      • Time limit: 100 seconds
      • Daily use limit: 1
  • The items Gilded Clockwork and Eternal Gilded Clockwork are tradable once. Upon being traded, they can only be transferred between characters within the same world.

Note

  • The use count for 'Gilded Clockwork' and 'Eternal Gilded Clockwork' resets daily at 12:00 AM UTC.
    • 'Gilded Clockwork' and 'Eternal Gilded Clockwork' can be used during the event period.
  • Each Booster item does not share a daily use limit.
    • Booster items refer to 'VIP Booster', 'HEXA Booster', 'Gilded Clockwork', and 'Eternal Gilded Clockwork'.
    • You cannot use another Booster item while one is already active.
  • When using 'Gilded Clockwork' or 'Eternal Gilded Clockwork', if you possess both a tradable-once item and an item that can only be transferred between characters within the world, the item that appears first in your inventory will be used first.

Lepa's Dashing Carriage

November 12 (after maintenance) - December 16 11:59 PM UTC

How to Participate

  • Select [Hunting Event] Lepas Dashing Carriage from the Event List and click Participate to start.
  • Hop into a hunting zone with enemies near your level (20 levels above and 20 levels below) and immediately have the Preparing Lepas Snacks skill activated.
    • Once this is activated, defeating enemies will charge the gauge.
  • Defeating 250 enemies fills your gauge and triggers the Lepa Dash.
    • Lepa Dash skill will increase your EXP and Lepa will pull up with their carriage, attacking nearby enemies!

Note

  • The Preparing Lepas Snacks skill will be deactivated once you have reached all 15 daily uses per character.
  • You can deactivate the Preparing Lepas Snacks skill by right-clicking the skill icon in the skill window. Once deactivated, the skill will remain until 12:00 AM UTC, and can be reactivated by right-clicking again.
    • The deactivated skill will be reactivated even if you log back in after logging out.
  • You can select automatic or manual use mode for the Lepa Dash skill by right-clicking the skill icon in the UI.
  • The Preparing Lepas Snacks skill only activates in fields with enemies near your level (20 levels above and 20 levels below) and cannot be activated in fields under the effect of a Lv. 4 Rune's Curse, or other special fields (Mirror World, story quest fields, etc.).
  • Lepa Dash is affected by EXP gain increase effects and death penalty EXP reduction effects.
  • The Rune EXP effect is applied when gaining EXP from Lepa Dash, and it applies even if the Rune has not been released.
  • You can only level up a maximum of 1 level with the EXP obtained from Lepa Dash.
  • Enemies defeated by the Lepa Dash skill do not count toward the 250 enemies near your level required to activate the skill again.

Eve Anticipation

November 12 (after maintenance) - December 16 11:59 PM UTC

How to Participate

  • Upon entering the Twilight Altar, you gain EXP every 5 seconds.
  • Boost your gains by progressing through the Waking the Power of Time event.
  • Characters Lv. 294 and above will receive the EXP amount equal to a Lv. 294 character.
  • EXP can only be gained within the event period.

CHALLENGER WORLD EVENTS

Challenger World

November 12 (after maintenance) - April 22 2:00 PM UTC

Quick Overview

Event Currency

  • Challenger Points: Earn points to raise your Challenger Tier, upgrade buffs, and claim exclusive rewards.
  • Challenger Coins and Advanced Challenger Coins: Obtainable by completing missions and can be exchanged in the Challenger Shop for growth and progression items.

Three Types of Challenger World Missions:

  • Hunting Missions: Defeat enemies near your level to earn Challenger Points and Coins.
  • Level Missions: Reach specific level milestones and get additional rewards!
  • Boss Missions: Defeat bosses to earn Points, Challenger Coins, and Advanced Challenger Coins.

How to Participate

  • From the world selection screen, you can choose to play in either Challenger-Heroic or Challenger-Interactive world.
    • Challenger Worlds follow the same perks, restrictions, prices, and systems as their respective world counterparts.
  • Once a Challenger World is chosen, all characters created there can only be played in that same world.
    • Example: If your first character was created in Challenger-Heroic, you cannot create or access Challenger-Interactive, even if all existing characters are deleted.
  • You can create up to 5 characters in Challenger World.
    • Up to 3 Tera Burning characters can be created to level from Lv. 10 - 200, gaining 2 extra levels per level-up!
  • After creating a character, select Challenger World from the Event List UI and click Participate to start the Challenger World event.
  • Complete Challenger World Missions to earn rewards and strengthen your buffs.
  • The following features are unavailable in Challenger World.
    • Transfer Link Skill
    • Legion
    • Legion Artifact System
    • Monster Collection
    • Expand Character Slots
  • The Meso Market is available through Miss Richfield in Challenger-Interactive and closes April 22, 2026 at 2:00 PM UTC.
    • The 3-day restriction for using the Meso Market or Auction House after creating a new character has been removed.

Challenger World Perks

Enjoy exclusive perks and gifts to kickstart your next challenge in a new world!

  • Challenger World Character Creation Gift
    • Click the Claim Creation Reward button in the event U to receive the following items:
      • Pearl Maple Armor Set Box: Untradable, 7-day duration. Open to receive:

      • (Interactive Worlds) Spell Trace (x1,000): Tradable within world, Permanent.
      • Equip, Use, Etc, and Set-up slots will be expanded to 64.
    • Note: Up to 5 Challenger characters can claim the rewards. Deleting a character will not reset the reward limit.
  • Tera Burning Gift
    • For Tera Burning characters, claim Tera Burning rewards by clicking the Claim Your Tera Burning Gift! button in the event UI.

        • Eternal Flame: Untradable, Permanent.

Challenger World Missions

  • Hunting Mission
    • Defeat 1,000 enemies near your level (20 levels above and 20 levels below), then click the [Mission Complete] button within the Challenger World UI to complete a Hunting Mission and receive 100 Challenger Points and 300 Challenger Coins.
    • The Hunting Mission can be done once a day and up to 5 times a week per account.
    • Missed a daily hunting mission? Use 3,000 Maple Points to complete a missed daily hunting mission.
      • The number of available Hunting Mission Passes updates every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
  • Level Missions
    • Reach specific level milestones with your Challenger character to earn Challenger Points and Challenger Coins.
    • Missions complete automatically when conditions are met in the Challenger World UI.
Mission Challenger Points Challenger Coins
Reach Lv. 260 3,000 3,000
Reach Lv. 265 3,000 3,000
Reach Lv. 270 5,000 4,000
Reach Lv. 275 7,000 5,000
Reach Lv. 280 9,000 7,000
  • Boss Missions
    • Defeat bosses to obtain Challenger Points, Challenger Coins, and Advanced Challenger Coins. Open the Challenger World UI to automatically complete the Boss Mission.
      • Defeating a boss in Practice Mode will count toward the mission.
      • Defeats will only count when solo or in a solo party.
    • Defeating a higher difficulty version of a boss will count as completing the mission for the highest listed difficulty for that boss.
      • Example: If the mission lists defeating Lotus in either Normal or Hard difficulty, defeating Extreme Lotus will count as completing the Hard difficulty mission.

Challenger Tier, Rewards, Buffs

  • There are 8 Tiers in Challenger World:
    • Bronze > Silver > Gold > Platinum, Emerald > Diamond > Master > Challenger
  • Earn Challenger Points through missions to increase your Tier, unlock rewards, and strengthen your buff.
    • Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum Tier Rewards: Claimable only in Challenger World.
    • Emerald, Diamond, Master, Challenger Tier Rewards: Claimable in either Challenger World or your main world via the Event List.
  • Rewards can be claimed until April 21, 2026 11:59 PM UTC.

Challenger Pass

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Available only for characters in Challenger World.

How to Participate

  • Select the [Challenger] Challenger Pass event from the Event List and click Participate to start the Challenger Pass event.
  • The Challenger Pass has 20 levels and you can level up by obtaining 480 Challenger Points for each level.
  • You can obtain Challenger Pass Points by completing weekly missions.

Weekly Missions

Defeat 30,000 monsters near your level 200

Pass Level Achievement Rewards

  • You can obtain a maximum of 3,000 Challenger Pass Points per week.
    • Challenger Pass Level, Challenger Pass Points and weekly mission progress are shared among all characters within the world.
    • Note that Weekly Challenger Pass Point acquisition and weekly mission progress will reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
    • Symbol Daily Quest, Monster Park, Monster Park Extreme, and Epic Dungeon missions completed using an Express Pass will also count towards weekly mission progress.
  • Missed a week? For 1,000 Maple Points, youll receive 100 Challenger Points and the total amount you can purchase depends on how many points were missed from the previous week.

Premium Pass Items

  • A Premium Pass is also available for 19,800 Maple Points, providing additional rewards on top of the regular Challenger Pass.
    • Normal Enemy Damage +200%
    • Obtained EXP +20%
  • Premium Pass items will be available depending on the current level of the Challenger Pass.
    • The Premium Pass effect will be removed when you World Leap.
    • All rewards can only be obtained once per world.
  • All rewards, excluding Sol Erda Fragments, can be traded within your account in the same world and can be used until February 23, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.
    • Sol Erda Fragments are untradable and permanent.

Arcane Seal

November 12 (after maintenance) - April 21 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 200 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Available only for characters in Challenger World.

How to Participate

  • After completing the quest A Greater Power you can participate by selecting the [Challenger] Arcane Seal event from the Event List and clicking on the Participate button.
    • The Arcane Seal event can only be done by one character at a time.
    • If you participate in the event with a different character after already starting the quest, all event progress on the original character will be reset.
  • 3 Sealing Wands will be automatically obtained daily at 12:00 AM UTC regardless if you are logged in or not.
    • Note: You can only have a maximum of 20 Sealing Wands at one time.
    • If you have 18-19 Sealing Wands at 12:00 AM UTC, you will only receive the amount needed to reach 20 Sealing Wands.
  • When using the Sealing Wands you can use 1 to 5 Sealing Wands at a time to break the barrier.
  • Once broken, you will obtain an Arcane Core of a certain rarity based on a set probability.
  • The type of barrier a player can break changes based on your Challenger World Tier.
  • The probability of obtaining each Arcane Core will change with each stage.

Barrier Appearances

Rank Barrier Breaking Conditions
Stage 1: Micro Barrier Below Gold
Stage 2: Small Barrier Gold or Higher
Stage 3: Medium Barrier Emerald or Higher
Stage 4: Large Barrier Diamond or Higher
Stage 5: Massive Barrier Master or Higher

Arcane Core Appearance Rates

Barrier Rank Normal Rare Epic Unique Legendary

Stage 4: Large Barrier 0.00% 29.95% 62.88% 6.65% 0.52%
Stage 5: Massive Barrier 0.00% 0.00% 91.85% 7.10% 1.05%
  • Arcane Cores can be equipped and will provide stats depending on the cores rarity and job.
  • Once equipped you can use the Arcane Core Summon skill to summon the equipped core.
    • If you equip a core with a higher rarity than one currently equipped, the equipped core will be extracted and you will receive Arcane Energy based on the rarity and enhancement level.
  • Note that stats obtained from equipping an Arcane Core will not apply if you World Leap from Challenger World to another world.
  • You are able to extract energy from unused Arcane Cores to obtain Arcane Energy.

    • An Arcane Core can be enhanced up to Stage 12.

Frontier Pass

November 12 (after maintenance) - April 21 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Not available for characters in Challenger Worlds.

How to Participate

  • Select the Frontier Pass event from the Event List and click Participate to start the Frontier Pass event.
    • You can only participate in the Frontier Pass event once per account.
    • The character participating in the Frontier Pass CANNOT be changed.
  • The Frontier Pass has a maximum of 30 levels and you can level up by obtaining 480 Pass Points for each level.
  • You can obtain Frontier Pass Points by completing weekly missions.

Weekly Mission Rewards

  • You can obtain a maximum of 2,000 Frontier Pass Points per week.
    • Frontier Pass missions can only be completed by the character participating in the event and are not shared with other characters.
    • If you have completed weekly boss clears, Monster Park, and Monster Park Extreme before participating in the Frontier Pass event, the progress WILL NOT be reflected in the Frontier Pass weekly missions.
  • Weekly Frontier Pass Point acquisition and weekly mission progress will reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
  • You will be able to purchase Frontier Pass Points missed from the previous week.
  • Please note that all rewards can only be obtained by the character participating in the event and can only be obtained once.
  • The Luxe Sauna Coupon can be moved between your characters within the world but all other items are untradeable.
  • Items other than the Sol Erda Fragments, which are permanent, can be used until April 21, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.
  • Luxe Sauna time charged before February 3, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC will expire after February 3, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.
  • Complete the following Weekly Missions to obtain Frontier Pass Points (x100):

BURNING EVENTS

Tera Blink

Tera Blink is back, and this time its here to stay!

November 12 (after maintenance) - Ongoing

Requirements

  • Newly created characters Lv. 10 and above that have been registered as Hyper Burning MAX characters or new Hyper Burning MAX Zero characters.

How to Participate

  • Tera Blink will now be available anytime a Burning effect is applied to a character (Hyper Burning MAX or Hyper Burning Beyond). Tera Blink will be unavailable when a Burning effect ends.
  • Accept the [Tera Blink] World Inside the Hat quest from Event List UI or talk to Spiegelmann located in Henesys or Nameless Town.
  • After completing the [Tera Blink] World Inside the Hat quest, speak to Spiegelmann to move to the map.
    • You can stay up to 40 minutes at one time in the event map.
    • You can freely enter and exit the event map by talking to NPC Spiegelmann.
  • All skill and buff effects given through the mission are collected and removed when you exit the event map.

Tera Blink: World Inside the Hat

  • There are 20 missions within the World Inside the Hat.
  • In Heroic Worlds and Challenger-Heroic, Mission 13 Equip Your Way to Victory! will be completed automatically and you'll also receive the Completion EXP.
  • Clearing each mission gives a large amount of EXP and some will reward items as well.
  • Note: Characters such as Cadena, Ark, and Illium will not be able to earn EXP in the World Inside the Hat if they have not completed their job tutorial quests.

Tera Blink Rewards

  • Completing Spiegelmann's Missions to receive the following:
    • Spiegelmann's Power Elixir (x1000): Untradable, Permanent.
    • Special Medal of Honor: Untradable, Permanent.
    • Dazzling Hat (Pet): Untradable, Permanent, 90-day magic duration.
    • Dazzling Hat's Aura (Pet Equipment): Untradable, Permanent.
  • Complete Tera Blink to receive the following completion rewards:
    • Spiegelmann's Hat Chair: Tradable within world, Permanent.
    • Spiegelmann's Dazzling Hat Effect: Untradable, Permanent.
  • Any character that completes Tera Blink will receive the completion rewards!

Hyper Burning MAX

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Characters between Lv. 200 to 258
  • Zero Characters are now eligible for Hyper Burning MAX (Must be Lv. 100 - 258 and have completed Story Quest Act 2).

How to Set Up Hyper Burning MAX Character

  • Click Set as Hyper Burning MAX to create your Hyper Burning MAX Character.

Hyper Burning MAX Character Perks

    • 1+4 Level-up
      • Hyper Burning MAX characters can gain 4 extra levels for each level up from Lv. 10 to 260.
        • Levels from Lv. 1-10 will only increase by 1.
      • If you create a Zero character as a Hyper Burning MAX character, you will receive the 1+4 level-up benefit from Lv. 100 to Lv. 260.
    • Level-Up Support rewards are distributed to all Hyper Burning MAX characters
      • You can get all of the following rewards by clicking the START button from the Hyper Burning MAX event UI.
    • Reach the level achievements as a Hyper Burning MAX character and obtain rewards!
      • You can get an even more enhanced level achievement reward in Challenger World.
      • When an existing character is set as Hyper Burning MAX, you cannot claim the level rewards for levels you already reached.
        • For example, when a Lv. 235 character is set as Hyper Burning MAX, you cannot claim the level rewards for Levels 200 - 235.

    • The items you get when using the Abyss Hunter Ring Coupon are permanent and are Tradable once within same account and world once.
    • The items you get when using the Infinite Flame Title Coupon are permanent and untradable, 60-day stat duration.

Beyond Burning

November 12 (after maintenance) - March 17 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Characters between Lv. 260 to 268 (Lv. 260 - 268 Zero characters and must have completed Story Quest Act 2).

How to Participate

  • Designate a Beyond Burning character from the character selection screen or by selecting Beyond Burning event within the Event List.

    • Only 1 Beyond Burning character can be designated per account.
    • Challenger World characters can be Beyond Burning.
  • Once confirmed, your character will receive the Beyond Burning effect.
    • The Beyond Burning effect cannot be removed.
  • Beyond Burning characters gain 1 extra level for each level-up from Lv. 260 to 270.

Beyond Burning Perks and Rewards

  • When your Beyond Burning character reaches level milestones, Level Achievement Rewards can be claimed from the Beyond Burning event UI.
    • Rewards can be claimed once per account.
  • When an existing character is set as Beyond Burning, you cannot claim rewards for levels you already reached.
    • Example: When a Lv. 264 character is set as Beyond Burning, the level rewards for Lv. 261 - 264 cannot be claimed.

Item Burning

November 12 (after maintenance) - April 21 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 200 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).
  • Completed the A Greater Power quest.

How to Participate

  • Select Get Your Item Burning Box! within the Event List and click Participate to claim your Item Burning Box.
  • Use the Item Burning Box to start the Item Burning event and receive a Challenger Equipment Set.
    • Item Burning Box: Tradable within world, expires April 21 at 11:59 PM UTC.
    • The Item Burning event can only be completed once per account.
  • Progress can be viewed by selecting Item Burning in the Event List.
  • There are 6 stages of missions to complete, each unlocking perks that enhance your Challenger Equipment.
  • After completing a mission, a gauge will unlock and can be accessed within the Item Burning UI. When the gauge is full, a Challenger Key can be obtained and used to apply the Ignitia Set Effect to an armor or weapon slots.
    • The Ignitia Set can be toggled on/off within the Item Burning UI.
    • The Ignitia Set Effect will be removed when the Item Burning event period ends
    • The gauge will not accumulate during the first week of the Item Burning System.

Challenger Equipment

  • Receive 8 types of Challenger Equipment corresponding to your job.
    • Challenger Hat
    • Challenger Top
    • Challenger Bottom
    • Challenger Gloves
    • Challenger Shoes
    • Challenger Cape
    • Shoulder Accessory
    • Challenger Weapon
  • Zero characters will not receive a Challenger Weapon and will instead have the perks applied on the current equipped weapon. A button will display in the UI to apply the Lapis/Lazuli Challenger Set Effect when another equipment set effect is active.
    • If the Lapis/Lazuli Challenger Set Effect is already applied, the button will be deactivated.
  • When an equipment item levels up, all equipped Challenger Equipment items will be unequipped.
  • Effects will be removed if the Fusion Anvil and Soul Enchanter are used on a piece of Challenger Equipment.

OTHER EVENTS

Character Creation Guide

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

A guide will be available on the world selection screen following your initial login. It covers World, Hyper Burning, and Job selection, making it easier to plan your character's growth. It also highlights any available new or revamped Jobs!

How to Participate

  • Upon logging in, you will be presented with the option of viewing the Character Creation Guide.
    • Selecting Open Guide will start the guide.
    • Selecting No Thanks will skip the guide.
      • Pressing ESC will also prompt you to skip the guide.
  • The Character Creation Guide can only be viewed once per account.

Character Creation Guide Process

  • If you choose to open the guide, the following process will begin:
    • A pop-up will appear showcasing the different available worlds and detailing the benefits of Challenger Worlds.
    • After selecting your desired World and Channel, you will be directed to the character selection screen.
    • You will then be recommended to create a new character utilizing the events, Hyper Burning MAX or Beyond Burning.
    • Upon selecting to create a character, you will be prompted to the Job Selection screen where you will be provided with Job information and recommendations!
    • Following this, you will be led to the Character Creation page, where you can customize your new character and finally embark on your journey!

    • When proceeding with a mission, you can choose whether to view the guide.
  • Completing a mission automatically unlocks the next one and allows you to claim the reward!

Luxe Sauna

November 12 (after maintenance) - February 3 11:59 PM UTC

Requirements

  • Lv. 101 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

How to Participate

  • Use a Luxe Sauna Coupon to charge the Luxe Sauna room time!
    • Luxe Sauna Coupon: Tradable within world, 7-day duration.
    • The use duration for the Luxe Sauna is recharged for 1 hour by using 3,000 Maple Points in the 'Use the Luxe Sauna' from the Event List.
    • Each coupon extends the time by 30 minutes and the charge time cannot exceed the event durations remaining time.
    • Coupons can only be used during the event period.
    • After the event period ends, you cannot obtain EXP even if there is time remaining for Luxe Sauna.
      • Luxe Sauna can be recharged for up to 48 hours in 1 week.
      • Luxe Sauna recharge count is reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.

  • Once the Luxe Sauna room is charged, either talk to the Hotel Receptionist in Sleepywood Hotel or click 'Use the Luxe Sauna' from the Event List and press the 'Participate' button to enter the Luxe Sauna Room.
    • You will not have access to the Luxe Sauna room if there are no charges.
  • While in the Luxe Sauna Room, receive EXP based on your level every 5 seconds.
    • Lv. 294 and above characters receive the same amount of EXP obtained at Lv. 294.
    • Burning characters can also participate in the event and receive EXP.

  • The Luxe Sauna charge time is shared among all characters in the same account and only decreases while in the Luxe Sauna Room..
    • The time will not decrease when you leave the game.
  • Check the remaining time by viewing the sign inside the Luxe Sauna Room.
  • Youll be automatically removed from the map when there are no more charges.
